intro: Cordylanthus platycephalus, commonly known as the broad-headed flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, flat-topped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pale purple. Cordylanthus platycephalus is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its native range.
